unblocker_task.title: Unblock Worker: Remove malformed task objects from state.json
unblocker_task.description: The state.json file contains two malformed task objects at array positions 3 and 4 (lines 100-117) that lack required fields (id, title, priority, description, acceptance, verification). These null-field tasks prevent the worker from selecting valid work. Remove these two malformed objects from the tasks array, leaving only the three valid tasks (WN-FIRE-004, WN-FIRE-006, WN-FIRE-007). Ensure the resulting JSON is valid.
acceptance: state.json tasks array contains exactly 3 task objects
All remaining tasks have valid id, title, priority, description fields
JSON syntax is valid (no trailing commas, proper structure)
verification: Would run: python -m json.tool .ralph/state.json > /dev/null (validates JSON syntax)
Would run: jq '.tasks[] | select(.id == null)' .ralph/state.json (should output nothing)

diagnosis: Worker is blocked because state.json contains two task objects (array indices 3-4, lines 100-117) with only default/empty values. These tasks have status='todo' but are missing all required fields: id, title, priority, description, acceptance, verification. Worker cannot select a task without these fields. The worker's code inspection also suggests that the remaining valid tasks (WN-FIRE-006, WN-FIRE-007) may already be implemented, but the immediate blocker is the malformed task objects preventing task selection. Surgical fix: remove the two malformed objects from the tasks array in state.json.
